page.title: 06St.Mary's/All Saints,Whalley
page.content: The only reference made of our area in the original{Domesday Book}mentions the church of St. Mary's in Whalley. Now named{St.Mary's & All Saints, the church's history goes back to Saxon times when known as{"The White {Church under the Hill".}The present structure dates back to the beginning of the 13th century. The church continues to serve a thriving community and as well as the regular Sunday church services the church organises{Prayer Groups, a {Mothers Union, Pram Services, Choir & {Bell Ringing Groups}and the{Uniformed {Brownies,Cubs,Scouts}and{Guides. A{Sunday School,}for pupils aged 3- 12 years,organises sessions of 1 hour, consisting of a short assembly followed by group discussion work based on the{Bible,}and the{life and {teachings}of{Jesus.
